Parking_Notes: Zero spaces if ADU is less than 1000 square feet or within one half mile of a major transit stop; otherwise one space per ADU; up to 300 square feet of ADU parking or storage does not count toward ADU floor area
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: Owner occupancy is not required by LUC 20.20.120
Entry_Orientation_Notes: Attached ADU must follow primary building standards; DADU must follow middle housing and detached accessory standards in LUC 20.20.538 and 20.20.125
Reference_Code_Section: See LUC 20.20.128 for optional mixed income or affordable housing provisions
Last_Reviewed_Date: https://bellevue.municipal.codes/LUC
Two_Side_Yards_Min_ft: Standards may be modified by critical area or conservation subdivision regulations
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Yes
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Existing accessory structures and guest cottages may be converted to ADUs; some conversions may exceed 1200 square feet when allowed by LUC 20.20.120
DADU_Setback_Notes: No more than two ADUs are allowed on a lot that permits a single family dwelling; no new ADU is allowed on a unit lot that already used ADU provisions
Critical_Area_Notes: DADUs must follow middle housing dimensional standards; a DADU may be located on a lot line that abuts an alley
Greenscape_Notes: Setbacks; density; and impervious limits may be modified by Critical Areas Overlay regulations in LUC 20.25H Front yard greenscape must meet or exceed fifty percent; existing nonconforming greenscape cannot be further reduced

Zone_Type: Professional Office with one dwelling unit allowed
Parking_Notes: Zero spaces if ADU is less than 1000 square feet or within one half mile of a major transit stop; otherwise one space per ADU; up to 300 square feet of ADU parking or storage does not count toward ADU floor area
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: Owner occupancy is not required by LUC 20.20.120
Entry_Orientation_Notes: Residential uses in PO must meet detached accessory and residential building standards as well as PO district standards
Reference_Code_Section: See LUC 20.20.128 for optional mixed income or affordable housing provisions
Last_Reviewed_Date: https://bellevue.municipal.codes/LUC
Two_Side_Yards_Min_ft: PO is primarily an office district; one dwelling unit is allowed and may have up to two ADUs when standards are met
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Yes
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Existing accessory structures and guest cottages may be converted to ADUs under LUC 20.20.120
DADU_Setback_Notes: No more than two ADUs are allowed on a lot that contains a dwelling unit; no new ADU is allowed on a unit lot that already used ADU provisions
Critical_Area_Notes: DADUs must follow detached accessory and middle housing dimensional standards; other PO district setbacks continue to apply
Greenscape_Notes: Setbacks and intensity may be modified by Critical Areas Overlay regulations in LUC 20.25H Greenscape standards for PO are set by general landscaping requirements in LUC 20.20.520

Parking_Notes: Per SMC 20.40.210(E) (as amended): one additional off-street space required for ADU unless lot is within 1/2 mile of a major transit stop, in which case no additional off-street parking is required.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: Owner occupancy prohibited by HB 1337
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: Building/fire code occupancy controls
Design_Standards_Notes: "ADUs follow principal setbacks; DADUs use accessory setbacks"
Notes: Max 1200 sf; interior exception; 2 ADUs per lot
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Conversion of existing space within primary dwelling or accessory structure allowed subject to ADU size, parking, and design standards.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Up to two ADUs per lot (any combination of attached and detached) subject to overall dwelling-unit limits and development standards for the underlying Neighborhood Residential zone.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Alley-side setbacks may be 0 ft

Parking_Notes: Per SMC 20.40.210(E) (as amended): one additional off-street space required for ADU unless lot is within 1/2 mile of a major transit stop, in which case no additional off-street parking is required.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner occupancy per HB 1337
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: General occupancy limits only
Design_Standards_Notes: "Attached ADUs follow principal setbacks; DADU per 20.50.020"
Notes: Two ADUs per lot; 1200 sf limit; interior exception
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Conversion of existing space within primary dwelling or accessory structure allowed subject to ADU size, parking, and design standards.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Up to two ADUs per lot (any combination of attached and detached) subject to overall dwelling-unit limits and development standards for the underlying Neighborhood Residential zone.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Accessory setbacks apply

Parking_Notes: Per SMC 20.40.210(E) (as amended): one additional off-street space required for ADU unless lot is within 1/2 mile of a major transit stop, in which case no additional off-street parking is required.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: Owner occupancy not permitted by state law
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: No separate ADU occupancy standard
Design_Standards_Notes: "Follows principal setbacks; DADU per accessory rules"
Notes: Two ADUs/lots; 1200 sf; conversion exception; 75% hardscape for 2+ units

ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Up to two ADUs per lot (any combination of attached and detached) subject to overall dwelling-unit limits and development standards for the underlying Neighborhood Residential zone.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Alley retention of 0ft rear

Parking_Notes: Per EMC 19.08.100 (Table 8-6): parking and vehicle access for ADUs governed by citywide standards in EMC Title 13 and Chapter 19.34; no separate numeric stall requirement specified beyond applicable zone/transportation standards.
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: Max 8 guests/set if used as STR
Design_Standards_Notes: ADU setbacks follow principal building setbacks; DADU may have 5-ft rear setback on non-alley lots (Table 6-4)
ADU_Conversion_Notes: ADUs may be located within principal dwelling or a separate accessory structure; ADU within one floor of principal dwelling not subject to the 1,000-sf maximum size limit.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: Up to two ADUs per principal dwelling unit in applicable residential zones; additional 5% lot coverage allowed for up to two ADUs per EMC 19.08.100.
DADU_Setback_Notes: street not allowed

Parking_Notes: No off-street parking required for ADUs citywide; other residential parking per 23.54.015.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner-occupancy requirement for ADUs; some short-term rental/B&B uses require a primary resident operator.
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: Subject to citywide STR and B&B regulations and building code occupancy limits.
Design_Standards_Notes: General NR/RSL residential design standards apply; additional tree and facade controls per 23.44.020 and 23.44.019.
Entry_Orientation_Notes: No ADU-specific entry orientation; general residential patterns apply.
Impact_Fees_Notes: Citywide transportation/school impact fees may apply; none ADU-specific in land use code excerpt.
Affordability_Requirements: None for ADUs; additional units above base density in NR/RSL may require affordable housing per 23.44.017.
Notes: NR/RSL standards as of June 30, 2025 middle-housing update. Height/FAR values shown are baseline; higher limits may apply on qualifying lots per 23.44.019.
ADU_Conversion_Allowed: Existing accessory structures and portions of principal structures may be converted to ADUs with some waivers to lot coverage and setbacks.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Up to two ADUs per lot inclusive of attached and detached.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: DADUs follow principal structure yards except may be in rear yard minimum 5 ft from non-alley lot lines and 0 ft from alley lot lines.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Lots with environmentally critical areas, shoreline or steep slopes may use alternative density calculations and have additional constraints.
Critical_Area_Notes: Tree requirements for new SFD and ADU construction per 23.44.020.

ADU_Conversion_Allowed: Existing accessory structures and portions of principal structures may be converted to ADUs with some waivers to lot coverage and setbacks.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Up to two ADUs per lot inclusive of attached and detached.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: DADUs follow principal structure yards except may be in rear yard minimum 5 ft from non-alley lot lines and 0 ft from alley lot lines.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Lots with environmentally critical areas, shoreline or steep slopes may use alternative density calculations and have additional constraints.
Critical_Area_Notes: Tree requirements for new SFD and ADU construction per 23.44.020.

Parking_Notes: No off-street parking required for ADUs citywide; other residential parking per 23.54.015.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner-occupancy requirement for ADUs; some short-term rental/B&B uses require a primary resident operator.
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: Subject to citywide STR and B&B regulations and building code occupancy limits.
Design_Standards_Notes: General NR/RSL residential design standards apply; additional tree and facade controls per 23.44.020 and 23.44.017.
Entry_Orientation_Notes: No ADU-specific entry orientation; general residential patterns apply.
Impact_Fees_Notes: Citywide transportation/school impact fees may apply; none ADU-specific in land use code excerpt.
Affordability_Requirements: None for ADUs; additional units above base density in NR/RSL may require affordable housing per 23.44.017.
Notes: NR/RSL standards as of June 30, 2025 middle-housing update. Height/FAR values shown are baseline; higher limits may apply on qualifying lots per 23.44.019.
ADU_Conversion_Allowed: Existing accessory structures and portions of principal structures may be converted to ADUs with some waivers to lot coverage and setbacks.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Up to two ADUs per lot inclusive of attached and detached.
ADU_Site_Limit_Notes: DADUs follow principal structure yards except may be in rear yard minimum 5 ft from non-alley lot lines and 0 ft from alley lot lines.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Lots with environmentally critical areas, shoreline or steep slopes may use alternative density calculations and have additional constraints.
Critical_Area_Notes: Tree requirements for new SFD and ADU construction per 23.44.020.

Parking_Notes: No off street parking required for ADUs; other residential parking per 23.54.015.
Owner_Occupancy_Notes: No owner occupancy requirement for ADUs; some short term rental or bed and breakfast uses require a resident operator.
Occupancy_Limit_Notes: One ADU allows up to eight unrelated residents total; two ADUs allow up to twelve unrelated residents total.
Min_Separation_From_Primary_ft: Lowrise design standards and modulation apply per SMC 23.45.
Design_Standards_Notes: Street orientation and transparency standards apply to principal units; ADU entries must be visually subordinate to main entries.
Entry_Orientation_Notes: Building permit ministerial
Process_Type: Mandatory housing affordability and citywide impact fees may apply where new residential floor area is added.
Impact_Fees_Notes: MHA performance or payment options per 23.58B and 23.58C on lots with MHA suffix.
Last_Reviewed_Date: ADU standards as of June 30 2025 in lowrise multifamily zones; exact FAR; height and yard standards vary by housing type and suffix.
ADU_Parking_Required: Existing accessory structures and portions of principal dwelling units may be converted to ADUs.
ADU_Parking_Exempt_If_Small: Up to two ADUs per lot where a principal dwelling unit is present; ADUs do not count toward residential density in LR zones.
ADU_Parking_Exempt_If_Transit: DADUs must meet accessory structure and rear yard provisions in 23.45.545; rear yards may be zero feet from alley lot lines where an alley is present.
ADU_Conversion_Allowed: Environmentally critical area and shoreline overlays may further limit height; coverage and placement.
ADU_Conversion_Notes: Landscaping; open space and Green Factor requirements apply per 23.45.522.
